sect1.title: DLC
sect1.para: DLC (Data Link Control) is a transport protocol developed by IBM for SNA (System Network Architecture), a protocol suite for network communication with mainframe computers. Particular versions of DLC are called SDLC (Synchronous Data Link Control) and HDLC (High-level Data Link Control). Along with its main uses in mainframe communication, DLC is the protocol used by many network-aware printers such Hewlett-Packard's JetDirect interface.
